1947 at the age of 16 a French teenager
Stephen Jordan had a profound Spiritual
Awakening Stephen Jordan had awakened to
his own self nature and to the very
nature of reality itself Jordan died in
2009 at the age of 77 his Awakening to
the nature of reality at 16 years old
never left him Jordan went on to write
many books on his Awakening and on
spiritual life and became famous
throughout France he became friends with
some of France's greatest philosophers
including Michelle Foucault and Jill de
Luz what had caused Stephen Jordan to
awaken as a teenager Stephen Jordan
became obsessed with the philosophy of
frenny Descartes particularly his cogito
Ergo soon or I think therefore I am
Jordan had absolutely no knowledge of
and only cursory exposure to any type of
Eastern spiritual teachings his
interests were exclusively in the
western philosophical tradition
particularly the Continental
philosophical tradition in the Buddhist
tradition Stephen Jordan might be called
a prathika Buddha or one who
independently achieves Awakening without
the aid of teachers or guides and
without going on to teach others to do
the same Jodha took up Descartes
statement of the kogito I think
therefore I am obsessively considering
it contemplating it virtually non-stop
in his every waking hour his inquiry
progressed to an intense inquiry very
similar to that of rinsei zenkoan
practice in Zen Quran practice a person
will intensely focus upon a question in
a very similar manner the Zen
practitioner will try with every fiber
of their being to penetrate the question
with their ordinary mind and
understanding striving to reveal the
nature of reality Rene Descartes cogito
Ergo soon is a Latin phrase that
translates to I think therefore I am it
is a famous philosophical statement and
a key element of Descartes philosophy
Descartes was searching for a completely
irrefutable truth he began by
recognizing that he could doubt almost
everything he could doubt the appearance
of the world itself it may be a dream or
a spell caused by a devil it was
Descartes thought possible to doubt
almost everything however the one thing
the Descartes felt could never be
doubted was his own existence why the
appearance of thought no matter what the
thought even the thought I don't exist
to Descartes proved the existence of an
entity who must be thinking the thought
Descartes had found what he was looking
for a truth that could not be doubted it
I exist the fact and evidence of
thinking proves it the 16 year old
Stephen Jordan became absolutely
obsessed with Descartes golgito Jordan
and quiet deeply where and what is the
Thinker who or what is producing thought
if thinking proves there must be a
thinker where and what is this thinker
this question is very similar to the
approach that we find in the teachings
of the Great Indian Sage Ramana maharshi
Ramana mahashi suggests that we inquire
deeply with the question who am I with
his contemplation of Descartes cogito
Jordan found himself asking a similar if
not the same question who is The Thinker
jordar reports that after many months of
this inquiry it suddenly dawned upon him
that Consciousness is not limited to our
physical bodies but is rather infinite
and eternal but how how did this
question lead Jordan to the realization
that his Consciousness was not limited
to his physical body how does this
inquiry of Jordans are indeed of Ramana
maharshi's question who am I lead to a
deep and profound understanding of the
nature of self and of reality
